Law Of The Case.origin: [the jury instructions were not objected to and thus became the law of the case ]

1.1: a doctrine in legal procedure: an issue esp. of law that has been decided (as by an appeals court) will not be reconsidered in the same case unless compelling circumstances warrant such reconsideration
